column4: hey guys, question, I have a network driver Realtek 8139/8139C/8139C+ which contains also a wireless. I am not managing to get the driver working. Any one knows a fix for this?
Are you sure?  What does iwconfig say?
lspci |grep ireless  #Tell us what that says.
Nothing
Is this a laptop or desktop?
laptop
Do you have the hardware switch toggled off?
It's on
lspci #look for the line that describes the Wireless device, show us.
What version of Ubuntu do you have installed?  lsb_release -a
there is nothing that says wireless. that's the problem
Yep sure is.  Are you sure the hardware switch is not toggled off?  May also need to look at the BIOS settings.
Yeps, all on, even the led is on
Software Modem would indicate a DialUp modem.
What do you see in the network manager?
Wired connection only
That's interesting.  Is this system fully updated?
Yes
Do you still have the LiveCD or USB that you installed with?  If so, boot to it and see if it works there.
I just don't know.  It's beyond me.  Maybe someone else will have something more.
